column5: I fished a new trib and from the looks of it every popular hole was packed with people.  So I had to find a little stretch of my own to fish.  This spot I choose had lots of snags but had potential to have fish in it.  After getting snagged and retying numerous times, I finally catch my first steelhead of the year  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oBiRRyC6crU  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-8yxlCcy6Qc
Nice fish!  Good job at handling it as well.
That's what it's all about!  Nice fish!
^^^ Thanks  Nice fish!  Good job at handling it as well.  These don't have sharp teeth
Nice one Pump!  You're working up quite a variety, I'm getting jealous! Finally getting out this weekend, hopefully I'll have a pic or two to add
^^^ Thanks   These don't have sharp teeth  You didn't let it flop around in the mud, you get bonus points.
Nice fish and great handling and release!  Burt
Nice fish and great handling and release!  Burt Looks like that fish couldnt wait to get out of dodge.LOL  Nicely done on all accounts.
My first steelhead caught with a hardbait.  We kept this one because the treble pierced its eye.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J-LAtCh5BaQ
At least now you know to switch those trebles to a single siwash.  Less lost lures and safe release on future fish.
I've killed way more rainbows with siwash hooks over trebles.  Rainbows always seem to take em in the brain.

If you're that worried about hooks, pinch the barbs... treble or siwash it doesn't matter.  I find siwash hooks do way more damage (especially out in the lake)..  Ends up making giant holes in their faces.
I'll be pinching 2 of the 3 barbs .  As for opener, I found it to be less fish then last year...I see lots of them spawning but I don't target those  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J1U4nW36HiY
Nice, I love the way the reel sounds when the fish is on a run.  It looks like the duck landing on the water triggered the one fish.   Ven
